feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued October 26 at 9:43AM AKDT until October 26 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: Southerly winds have brought in warmer temperatures near sea level for Haines and Skagway. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 11 inches.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Municipality of Skagway

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 26 at 11:17AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney affecting Seminole County. .The St. Johns River above Lake Harney at Geneva remains in Major Flood Stage. The river is forecast to continue a slow decline, dropping from Major to Moderate Flood Stage by this weekend. Interests along the river will continue to see major flood impacts,
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 26 at 11:16AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .The Saint Johns River at Sanford is forecast to remain in Moderate Flood Stage through early next week while continuing a slow decline. Interests along the river will continue to see moderate flood impacts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 26 at 11:15AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Deland is forecast into Moderate Flood Stage by Thursday, then continue slowly declining through Moderate Flood stage through this weekend. Interests along the river should expect these major flood impacts to continue, but a recession of
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 26 at 11:05AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

cap:geocode.value: MEZ014 MEZ021 MEZ022 MEZ025 MEZ026 MEZ027 MEZ028

entry.title: Flood Watch issued October 26 at 2:48PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Heavy rainfall continues to move inland from the Gulf of Maine waters over Eastern Maine and will track northward this evening. Deep tropical moisture combined with strong upper level dynamics will support heavy rainfall. Small rivers, streams and creeks are swollen and with grounds soaked, will result in significant runoff through this evening.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Southeast Aroostook

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 26 at 1:57AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty northwest winds expected this afternoon... A quick moving system will move through northeastern Nevada today. entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Elko County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; South Central Elko County; Southeastern Elko County; Southwest Elko County

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 26 at 10:03AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: Light to moderate snow is expected this afternoon and tonight over the Snowy and Sierra Madre mountains. At this time, accumulations will range from three to six inches, highest above 9000 feet. Winds gusting to 30 MPH will create occasional blowing snow and reduced visibility. Mountain passes will become snow covered and slick.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 26 at 9:32AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Another round of snow today and tonight... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Snow. Accumulations of 4 to 6 inches in the mountains; 1 to 2 inches in the valleys. Wind gusts of 25 to 30 mph in open areas.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Jackson Hole; Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Star Valley; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains
